page.title: 10Entertainment & Recreation 2
page.content: Clubs and groups in Pencombe cater for people of all ages. A Brownie Pack meets weekly for young girls aged 7 to 11. Young Farmers meet fortnightly for young people interested in agriculture. An Archery club has recently been formed and now has members of all ages. Pencombe Cricket Club compete in friendly games throughout the county and the Wheelwrights Clay Pigeon Club also is popular with many local men. The Womens Institute holds monthly meetings in the Parish Hall and also organises outings and an annual Produce show. All the groups hold their own fund-raising events. A caravan site at Sparrington farm is licensed for 5 caravans. There is also trout fishing at Newhouse Farm and Hegdon Hill is a favourite location for Citizen Band Radio enthusiasts.
